column4: do we have VDPAU support for all relevant applications in Oneiric Ocelot?
mplayer does
have you tried playing 1080p content and watched the cpu load?
no, but you will notice the improvement
thanks for this information
don't know if you still have to do this or not: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RestrictedFormats/BluRayAndHDDVD#Playback_using_VDPAU_acceleration
downer
not really, as there were special dependencies neccessary which weren't available for this ubuntu version
hrmm?
that is a little too much effort, dont you think?
gotcha
in Gentoo it's just emerge -DNatuv world, done :p
same with freeBSD, which i normally use, but since it lags multimedia functionality massively i switched to ubuntu
maybe time for Gentoo then :p
are there repositorys for already compiled binary packages in gentoo?
i would only compile if theres is a need to (needing special options in a package or something)
yeah but they tend to be few and far between, outside of the important ones at tinderbox
there's Sabayon's binaries, but I wouldn't really trust those

then i wouldnt want to go with gentoo, thats the big advantage with freeBSD, you have everything binary directly coming from the freeBSD package maintainers (trusted), and if you like to, you can just compile everything but you dont have to
yeah, but with that whole lagging behind thing, apparently :p
it is for things like vdpau, but that doesn't involve 'everything' indeed
yes
